ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This course provided a great foundation in German theater and its history, covering texts written in a variety of styles and throughout countless time periods.
Survey of German theater from Schiller and Goethe to Brecht and Muller. LOTS of practice speaking, reading, writing in German.
Improved fluency in spoken and written German, as well as much greater insight into the German theater tradition.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Strengths: Thiti is great. He really cares about his students and their learning. The plays that we read were challenging yet engaging. Assignments were open-ended and allowed students to focus on topics of interest to them. Weaknesses: No major ones. The virtual format could make discussion difficult at times. Texts could be difficult to understand, though Thiti usually did a good job of helping us understand the day's readings in class.

Strengths of the course were the material and instructor. Thiti was super engaged as an instructor and made really thoughtful presentations for every class meeting. His feedback on our reading responses and essays was also super detailed and helpful. Reading entire works in German was challenging but rewarding--I've now probably read more complete plays in German than in English!
Can't really name weaknesses: just be aware that if you're not a native German speaker that you'll be spending a lot of time looking up vocab/plot summaries to supplement the readings.

The course covered a great amount of material in a short period of time, which was both good and bad.  I feel that perhaps it could have focused on a slightly narrower scope of material and gone deeper with some of the texts, considering that many of them were challenging to read in the amount of time given.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: The online format was not detrimental, particularly since we were such a small class (5 students). The seminar format, particularly with a small class, was great and fostered participation from everyone naturally.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes. The plays we read are interesting and provide a unique insight into German literature. Thiti cares about students and is dedicated to their success.

Yes! Great course to continue learning and practicing German. For anyone who started German at L1: definitely doable to take this course, just make sure that you stay on top of keeping vocab lists and studying them (it really helps!!).
Yes - it was very interesting and gave an informative overview of German theater and culture over centuries.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
